radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral pleural effusions and pulmonary vascular redistribution, suggestive of congestive heart failure.
Normal systolic function, mitral annular calcification, and mild mitral regurgitation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up echocardiogram after 1 month showed only mild MR with vigorous LV (LV ejection fraction 80%) and improved pulmonary hypertension.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe mitral regurgitation with incomplete closure and apical tenting, and regional wall motion abnormalities with inferoapical dyskinesis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Apical wall motion abnormalities had resolved along with mitral valve tethering 1 month after LAD revascularization.
